children.name: a school for children (up to age of 18)
school
children.definition: a place where children go to learn and be taught, up to the age of 18 :
examples: His mother always used to pick him up from school.

children.name: attend
children.definition: a
examples: schoolformal(= go to a school )Some of the children had not attended school very regularly before.

children.name: send sb to school
examples: His parents sent him to a private school.

children.name: a state schoolBritish English,a public schoolAmerican English
children.definition: a school that gets its money from the government
examples: Universities want to encourage more applicants from state schools.

children.name: a private school
children.definition: alsoa public schoolBritish English
examples: (= a school where students pay to study )He was educated at a private school.

children.name: sb’s old school
children.definition: the school someone went to when they were young
examples: He went back to his old school to give a talk to the children.

children.name: a local school
children.definition: a school near where someone lives
examples: They sent their kids to the local school.

children.name: a boarding school
children.definition: a school where children also live and sleep

children.name: a day school
children.definition: a school where children go during the day but go home in the evenings
examples: The school is both a boarding school and a day school.

children.name: a nursery school
children.definition: for children under 5

children.name: an infant schoolBritish English
children.definition: for children aged 5 to 7

children.name: a primary schoolBritish English,an elementary schoolAmerican English
children.definition: for children up to 11
examples: Their children are still at primary school.

children.name: a secondary school
children.definition: alsoa high schoolBritish English
examples: (= for children from 11 to 16 or 18 )

children.name: a high schoolAmerican English
children.definition: a school for students aged 14 to 18

children.name: a comprehensive schoolBritish English
children.definition: a secondary school for all children

children.name: a grammar schoolBritish English
children.definition: a secondary school for children who have passed an exam when they are 11

children.name: school students
children.definition: alsoschool pupilsBritish English
examples: Most school students have musical interests of some kind.

children.name: a school friend
examples: She met some old school friends.

children.name: a school uniform
examples: He was still wearing his school uniform.

children.name: the school holidays
examples: British English The trip will take place during the school holidays.

children.name: the school runBritish English
children.definition: the journey taking children to and from school each day
examples: She had to be back in time for the school run.

children.name: the school curriculum
examples: Head teachers were asked to incorporate road safety education in the school curriculum.

children.name: school meals/lunches
children.definition: alsoschool dinnersBritish English
examples: We provide good-quality school meals.

children.name: a school governorBritish English
children.definition: an elected person who works with teachers to make decisions about how a school is organized
examples: The school governors have appointed a new head teacher.

children.name: the school boardAmerican English
children.definition: the group of people who are elected to govern a school or group of schools
examples: The courts have upheld the school board's right to dismiss striking teachers.

children.name: the school day
examples: Most children are tired at the end of the school day.

children.name: at schoolattending school especially British : đang là học sinh
examples: She must be about 16 - she’s still at school.

children.name: in schoolespecially American
examples: Kyle is one of the most popular boys in school.

children.name: out of schoolno longer at school : không còn là học sinh nữa
examples: I’ve only been out of school a couple of years, but I’ve forgotten all the math I learned.

children.name: go to schoolattend school : đến trường
examples: Jessica’s still too young to go to school.

children.name: the school playground/ library/ hall/ bus
nursery school
children.definition: nurseryschool a school for children aged between about two and five where they play and do activities with other children: trường mãu giáo (2 đến 5 tuổi)
examples: Ian will soon be old enough to go to nursery school.

children.name: preschool
children.definition: US a school for children aged between about two and five:giáo dục mầm non(2 đến 5 tuổi)
examples: Eastin is calling for a plan to provide free preschool for all 4-year-olds.

children.name: kindergarten
children.definition: US the first year of school for children aged 5:mẫu giáo (5 tuổi)
examples: Katie was one of the few children who could read when she started kindergarten.
Mrs. Marks was my kindergarten teacher.

children.name: primary school
children.definition: in UK, a school for children aged between five and eleven:tiểu học
examples: My father entered primary school in 1958.
Primary school children know more today than we did at that age.

children.name: elementary school
children.definition: / grade school in the US, a school for children aged between five and twelve in some places, and five and ten in other places:trường tiểu học

children.name: In grade school, Karen sang in the school chorus
examples: The senator met with a group of elementary school students learning about how government works.

children.name: secondary school
children.definition: in UK, a school for children aged between 11 and 18; in the US, a name for middle school, junior high school, and high school considered together as a group: trường trung học
examples: Everyone in his family had at least completed secondary school.

children.name: As children enter secondary school, parents often do not have the necessary knowledge to help with homework
middle school
children.definition: a school for children aged between 9 and 13 in Britain and 10 and 14 in some parts of the US:trung học cơ sở
examples: Kim attends Byrd Middle School in Sun Valley.
The arts and crafts fair is geared toward middle school students.

children.name: junior high school
children.definition: a school for children aged between 12 and 14 or 15, especially in some parts of the US:trường trung học
examples: I started taking French in junior high school.
Drug use among junior high school students has fallen.

children.name: high school
children.definition: in the US, a school for children aged between 15 or 16 and 18:trường trung học
examples: Brad was the captain of his high school football team.
The program requires high school students to take at least one college-level course.

children.name: go to high school
examples: Where do you go to high school?

children.name: graduate from high schoolsuccessfully complete high schooltốt nghiệp trung học
examples: He’s been working full time since graduating from high school last June.

children.name: comprehensive school
children.definition: in UK, a school for children aged 11-16 or 11-18 that most students attend because it accepts people of all abilities and is paid for by the government:trường phổ thông hỗn hợp

children.name: sixth form college
children.definition: in UK, a college for students aged between 16 and 18:trường cao đẳng cho lứa từ 16 -18 tuổi

children.name: a place where people over 18 can study
school
children.definition: US informal a university or similar institution:

children.name: go to schoolstudy at a college or university
examples: Phil gave up his job, and he’s going back to school next year.

children.name: post-secondary
children.definition: US use this about education that takes place after a student has finished high school:sau trung học
examples: Eighty-five percent of high school students in the program go on to post-secondary education.

children.name: university
children.definition: a place where students study one or two subjects at a high level, in order to get degrees:
examples: the University of Chicago
In 1986 32% of Saudi Arabian university professors were women.
at a university
She’s at Cambridge University.
university of
the University of Texas
a university departmentone of the oldest university departments in the country

children.name: go to university
examples: BritishShe wants to go to university to study biology.

children.name: be at university
examples: BritishBoth my sisters are at university.

children.name: study
children.definition: something
examples: at a universityShe studied law at Edinburgh University.

children.name: apply for university
examples: I applied for university without any real idea of what I wanted to do.

children.name: start university
children.definition: alsoenter universityformal
examples: Some people take a year off before they start university.

children.name: leave university
examples: Students often find work soon after leaving university.

children.name: graduate from university
children.definition: leave after getting a degree
examples: She graduated from Liverpool University in 2006.

children.name: drop out of university
children.definition: leave before finishing your course
examples: He dropped out of university in order to join a rock band.

children.name: a university course
examples: He studied history at school and was now planning to take a university course.

children.name: a university student
examples: Thirty years ago 33% of university students were female.

children.name: a university graduate
children.definition: someone who has completed a university course
examples: She is a university graduate who speaks three languages.

children.name: a university lecturer/professor
examples: Her father was a university lecturer and her mother a teacher.

children.name: a university degree
examples: He was a qualified engineer with a university degree.

children.name: a university education
examples: I did not have the advantage of a university education.

children.name: the university campus
children.definition: the area of land containing the main buildings of a university
examples: There were violent protests on university campuses.

children.name: adult education
children.definition: classes for adults, often in the evenings, either because they want to improve their skills or for interest and enjoyment: giáo dục cho người lớn
examples: The government needs to do more to fund adult education for the unemployed.

children.name: college
children.definition: USa large school where you can study after high school and get a degree:
examples: Some people who want togo to collegestill can’t get there.
in college
Fran just finished her freshman year in college.
a decline in the number ofcollege studentsstudying history
acollege education
college campuses
college graduatesomeone who has successfully completed college
Many college graduates are unable to find work in their field.

children.name: college
children.definition: a school for advanced education, especially in a particular profession or skill :
examples: a teacher training college
Donna left school and went to art college.
college of
the London College of Fashion
at college
We were great friends when we were at college.
a college student/teacher/lecturera sixth-form college student

children.name: go to
children.definition: a
examples: collegeAfter university I went to drama college for a year.

children.name: attend
children.definition: a
examples: collegeformal He was the first person in his family to attend college.

children.name: finish
children.definition: at
examples: collegeWhat are you going to do when you finish art college?

children.name: an art/music/drama college
examples: The Music College was founded in 1869.

children.name: an agricultural/secretarial/technical etc college
examples: I wanted a job in farm management so I went to agricultural college.

children.name: a teacher training college
children.definition: where you learn to be a teacher

children.name: a military college
children.definition: where you learn to be an officer in the army

children.name: a Further Education/FE collegeBritish English
children.definition: where adults can go to study, especially part-time

children.name: a tutorial collegeBritish English
children.definition: where you can have private or small group lessons

children.name: a sixth form collegeBritish English
children.definition: where students in Britain can go at 16, instead of a school

children.name: graduate school
children.definition: a college or university where you can study for a master’s degree or a doctorate, after receiving your first degree : cao học
examples: I taught for a few years, and then went back to graduate school.

children.name: community college
children.definition: (alsojunior college)USa school that students can go to for two years in order to learn a skill or prepare for university :
examples: Community colleges can provide job-specific training.

children.name: parts of a large university or college
law school
children.definition: / medical school/ business school a university or part of a university where you study law, medicine, or business:trường đại học luật/y/kinh tế
examples: My father always wanted me to go to law school.

children.name: Harvard Business School
examples: He’s applied to all the best medical schools in the country.

children.name: college
children.definition: one of the groups of teachers and students that form a separate part of some universities, especially in UK :
examples: Trinity College, Cambridge

children.name: classroom
children.definition: a roomin a school or college where groups of students are taught : phòng học
examples: in the classroombeing taught by a teacher:
Students learning computer studies spend two days each week in a computer lab and four days in the classroom.

children.name: board
children.definition: nounWOOD bảng

children.name: campus
children.definition: the land and buildings of a university or college, including the buildings where students live : khu trường sở
examples: a beautiful campus in New England
on/off campus
Most first-year students live on campus.
There's accommodation for about five hundred studentsoncampus.

children.name: faculty
children.definition: a department or group of related departments within a university.
examples: the Arts/Law Faculty
faculty of
the Faculty of Law
the Engineering Faculty

children.name: blackboard
children.definition: noun( bang den )
examples: a dark surfaceon a wall or frame which a teacher writes on withchalk(= white substance)

children.name: break up
children.definition: phrasal verbSTOP CLASSES

children.name: UKWhen schools and colleges, or the teachers and students who go to them break up, their classes stop and the holidays start
examples: _We broke upforthe holidays in June.
